entity_types.name: Researcher
entity_types.description: Individuals involved in academic or policy research, often with specialized expertise.
common_contexts: using the subscription based ai products

entity_types.name: AI Tool/Product
entity_types.description: Software or platforms utilizing artificial intelligence to assist with various tasks.

entity_types.name: Causal Inference Method
entity_types.description: Specific statistical or research designs used to determine cause-and-effect relationships.
common_contexts: methods are in the Quiver for causal inference
commonly are these methods used at RAND

entity_types.name: Organization
entity_types.description: Institutions, centers, or agencies where research is conducted, managed, or funded.

entity_types.name: Research Process/Activity
entity_types.description: Stages or tasks involved in conducting research, from planning to analysis.

entity_types.name: Code/Script
entity_types.description: Programming instructions or sequences used in data analysis, automation, or software development.
common_contexts: convert this R code to Stata code

entity_types.name: Data
entity_types.description: Information, often numerical or textual, collected, cleaned, and analyzed for research purposes.
common_contexts: clean and prepare it for use

entity_types.name: Patient
entity_types.description: Individuals receiving medical care or participating in studies, often as subjects.

entity_types.name: Provider
entity_types.description: Individuals or entities offering services, such as medical care.

entity_types.name: Librarian
entity_types.description: Professionals who manage and provide access to information resources, often assisting with research.
common_contexts: a librarian gave us the initial list

entity_types.name: Attorney
entity_types.description: Legal professionals who use tools for tasks like tracking legislation or managing time.
common_contexts: I have a sister who is an attorney
uses it in ways I would not think of

entity_types.name: Intellectual Property
entity_types.description: Creations of the mind, such as inventions, literary and artistic works, designs, and symbols, which are legally protected.
common_contexts: I don’t want to inadvertently take someone else’s intellectual property

entity_types.name: Training/Education
entity_types.description: Structured learning or instruction provided to enhance skills or knowledge, particularly regarding new technologies like AI.
common_contexts: need for Training/education on AI at RAND
showcasing how ppl use it successfully

relationship_types.name: USES
relationship_types.description: An entity utilizes a tool, method, or concept for a specific purpose.

example_relationships.context: Providers and patients and they are using Otter to take notes
heard lots of researchers that are using the subscription based ai products
I have used AI tools to help with my code
I’ve used the RAND Chat
some federal agencies are using the Api

relationship_types.name: PERFORMS
relationship_types.description: An entity carries out a specific process, activity, or task.

example_relationships.context: we host seminars and journal clubs
I’ve been writing proposals non-stop
we did the literature review
The researcher has honed that overtime so not easily replicating it. But the time-consuming process of pulling data down

relationship_types.name: HAS_EXPERTISE_IN
relationship_types.description: An entity possesses specialized knowledge or skill in a particular domain or method.

example_relationships.context: convener of researchers who have expertise in causal inference techniques
hard for ppl who are not experts to understand [methods]

relationship_types.name: IMPROVES
relationship_types.description: An AI tool or method enhances the quality, efficiency, or outcome of a process or code.

example_relationships.context: I have used AI tools to help with my code
How helpful are LLM’s for proposals.
check the code, annotate the code, replicability those are time consuming and for AI.

relationship_types.name: GENERATES
relationship_types.description: An AI tool produces new content such as text, summaries, or images.

example_relationships.context: it transcribes and summarizes.
say write an executive summary; it is great at doing that
telling it to, to make an image for proposal.

relationship_types.name: IS_PART_OF
relationship_types.description: An entity or organization is a component or division within a larger organizational structure.

example_relationships.context: I view the Center as a convener of researchers
Used to be under Pardee and now GER

relationship_types.name: REQUIRES
relationship_types.description: A method or process necessitates the availability or use of specific data or resources.

example_relationships.context: depends on the data bc what do you have available to do an evaluation

relationship_types.name: CAUSES_CONCERN_FOR
relationship_types.description: An aspect of AI use or its output creates apprehension or ethical concerns for a user.

example_relationships.context: Anything about using AI at RAND that makes you nervous?
I don’t want to inadvertently take someone else’s intellectual property.

relationship_types.name: PROVIDES_GUIDANCE_TO
relationship_types.description: An entity or tool offers advice, training, or explanatory information to another entity.

example_relationships.context: can it tell me if this is a valid design.
explain like I’m five.
could give a rundown of how they use it day to day.
